intro: Microseris montana, commonly known as the mountain globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and have a rough texture, while its seed pods are cylindrical and split open when mature. Microseris montana is often found in meadows and along mountain slopes at high elevations.
